title: Prime Minister of France - Wikipedia
snippet: The current prime minister of France is Sébastien Lecornu who was appointed on 9 September 2025 and resigned on 6 October 2025, but was re-appointed on 10 October.

title: Sébastien Lecornu - Wikipedia
snippet: Sébastien Lecornu (French: [sebastjɛ̃ ləkɔʁny]; born 11 June 1986) is a French politician who has served as Prime Minister of France since 2025.

title: Opinion | France Needs a New France - The New York Times
snippet: In France, it has been a frenzied fall. First, the government was toppled by an irate Parliament. Then, in a panic, President Emmanuel Macron tapped a protégé, Sébastien Lecornu, to be prime minister...

title: Macron names ally Sébastien Lecornu as new French PM
snippet: 9 September 2025 · ShareSave · Paul KirbyEurope digital editor · ShareSave · EPA · Sébastien Lecornu (L) has served as Emmanuel Macron's armed forces minister for the past three years · President Emmanuel Macron has named close ally ...

title: France to start 2026 without budget after talks fail | Reuters
snippet: French Prime Minister Sebastien Lecornu gestures as he speaks during the questions to the government session at the National Assembly in Paris, France, December 16, 2025.
